intro: Ilex lagoensis, commonly known as the Lagoense Holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to the island of Hispaniola, specifically found in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. The plant is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are glossy, elliptical, and have serrated margins, while its flowers are small and white, appearing in clusters. The fruit is a bright red drupe, which is edible and serves as a food source for various wildlife species.
